message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this great product at a special price. I think you'll really love it!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle?

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, I'm not quite willing to meet you at $120. I can offer you a slight discount, but I think a fair price for this product would be $160. Would you be willing to consider that?
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $160 is still a bit out of my budget. I was thinking more along the lines of $140. Can you meet me at that price?

I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. I can see you're really interested in the product, and I appreciate that. However, $140 is still a bit too low for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $140 and $160, so I can offer you $150. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I can offer $130 for the product. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I'm starting to feel like we're getting a bit too far apart, Bob. I'm not willing to go as low as $130, but I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer you $145, which is the lowest I'm willing to go. What do you think?
I appreciate your concession, but $145 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $135, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. Can you meet me at that price?

I've made a few concessions already, and I'm not willing to go any lower than $145. I'm willing to hold firm at this price, but I'm open to negotiating further if you're willing to meet me at this point. If not, I may need to consider other options.

I understand that you're not willing to go any lower than $145, but I'm still not willing to pay that much. I'm willing to make a final offer of $80, which is the maximum I'm willing to pay. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying the product from John for $80.
